==History==
==History==
The ''Xiuzhen tu'' text probably dates "from the early 19th century" (Komjathy 2004:53) and exists in several versions, some with variant titles like ''Xiuzhen quantu'' ä¿®çå¨å "Cultivation of Perfection Complete Diagram". All editions are associated with the [[Dragon Gate Taoism|Longmen]] "Dragon Gate" sect of the Quanzhen school of Daoism. Catherine Despeux (2008:770) lists five extant versions: a [[stele]] at the Sanyuan Gong ä¸åå®® "Three Primes Palace" in [[Guangzhou]] (dated 1812); printed versions from the [[Wudang Mountains]] (1924 reprint of 1888), [[Shanghai]] (1920), and [[Chengdu]] (1922); and a version at the [[White Cloud Temple]] in [[Beijing]] (undated).
The ''Xiuzhen tu'' text probably dates "from the early 19th century" (Komjathy 2004:53) and exists in several versions, some with variant titles like ''Xiuzhen quantu'' ä¿®çå¨å "Cultivation of Perfection Complete Diagram". All editions are associated with the [[Dragon Gate Taoism|Longmen]] "Dragon Gate" sect of the Quanzhen school of Daoism.
